intro: Phyllanthus tanzaniensis, commonly known as Tanzanian spurge, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Phyllanthus tanzaniensis is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
